place.name: HENLLAN
place.gazetteerText: HENLLAN-AMGOED, a hamlet and a parish in the district of Narberth and county of Carmarthen. The hamlet lies on a branch of the river Taff, adjacent to Pembrokeshire, 3¼ miles N by W of Whitland r. station, and 6½ NE of Narberth. Acres, 1, 033. Real property, £865. Pop., 177. Houses, 35. The parish includes also the chapelry of Eglwysfairachyrig; and its post town is Whitland, under Narberth. Acres, 3, 651. Real property, £2, 071. Pop., 445. Houses, 91. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory, united with the p. curacy of Eglwysfairachyrig, in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £86. Patrons, the Landed Proprietors. The church is good, and there is an Independent chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
